issue.title: helmChart inflator friendly chart, including namespace
issue.body:
### MetalLB Version

any

### Deployment method

Charts

### Main CNI

-

### Kubernetes Version

-

### Cluster Distribution

-

### Describe the bug

no possibilities to define the namespace from within the chart.
defies capabilities by tooling such as the chart inflator provided by kustomize.

https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kustomize/issues/3815



### To Reproduce

use this as a reference:

```yaml
apiVersion: kustomize.config.k8s.io/v1beta1
kind: Kustomization
resources:
  - ./namespace.yaml
  - ./addresspool.yaml
  - ./l2advertisement.yaml

helmGlobals:
  chartHome: ../../../base/metallb-system


helmCharts:
- name: metallb
  releaseName: cluster0
  namespace: metallb-system
  includeCRDs: true
  repo: https://metallb.github.io/metallb
``` 

### Expected Behavior

the chart to be usable with the helm chart inflator.

### Additional Context

none

### I've read and agree with the following

- [X] I've checked all open and closed issues and my request is not there.
- [X] I've checked all open and closed pull requests and my request is not there.

### I've read and agree with the following

- [X] I've checked all open and closed issues and my issue is not there.
- [X] This bug is reproducible when deploying MetalLB from the main branch
- [X] I have read the [troubleshooting guide](https://metallb.universe.tf/troubleshooting/) and I am still not able to make it work
- [X] I checked the logs and MetalLB is not discarding the configuration as not valid
- [X] I enabled the debug logs, collected the information required from the cluster using the [collect script](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/metallb/metallb/main/troubleshooting/collect.sh) and will attach them to the issue
- [X] I will provide the definition of my service and the related endpoint slices and attach them to this issue

event though having `{ .Release.Namespace }` within the charts. was not able to deploy it.
there is no such field as `releaseNamespace` within the realms of the chartinflator

issue.title: simple global load balancing
issue.body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem?

Metalb is designed to be a create and manage local load balancer. But the BGP protocol can be used to create global load balancer using the concept of equal cost multi path.

It would be great if it was possible to use metallb to create global load balancers.

In fact it is simple to show that if two Loadbalancer Services in two different clusters are created with the same VIP and metallb is configured with BGP, the traffic will be load balanced across the two clusters.

The problem is that we cannot allow tenants to pick the VIPs for their LoadBalancer Services.

So some coordination is needed between the clusters across which one needs to establish global load balancing. And yet the metallb operator is cluster-bound and cannot "see" beyond the cluster it's running on.

### Describe the solution you'd like

I'd like to propose to use DNS as a means of coordination between the various metallb instances.
I'd like to be able to express the desire to have the VIP of a LoadBalancer service assigned by doing a dns lookup with a give FQDN.
For example if a LoadBalancer service is annotated with:
`metallb.io/assign-from-fqdn: myglobal.service.example.io`
The controller will try to resolve the name and proceed only when the name can be resolved to a VIP. At that point the controller will assign the VIP to the service (checking, obviously, that it belong to the authorized CIRDS and that it is available).
This simple change seems enough to implement rudimentary BGP-based global load balancers. In  the future perhaps it might be expanded with more load balancing strategies.

### Additional context

I am envisioning using this together with external-dns. So let's imaging two clusters. In cluster A we would ahve this LoadBalancer Service definition:
```yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: my-service
  annotations:
    external-dns.alpha.kubernetes.io/hostname: myglobal.service.example.io
spec:
  selector:
    app.kubernetes.io/name: MyApp
  ports:
    - protocol: TCP
      port: 80
      targetPort: 9376
  type: LoadBalancer
```
notice the extenral dns annotation that will name the resulting VIP to `myglobal.service.example.io`
and in cluster B, we would have this service definition:
 ```yaml
 apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: my-service
  annotations:
    metallb.io/assign-from-fqdn: myglobal.service.example.io
spec:
  selector:
    app.kubernetes.io/name: MyApp
  ports:
    - protocol: TCP
      port: 80
      targetPort: 9376
  type: LoadBalancer
 ```
causing the VIP to be assigned from the resolved name (after external-dns has done it's job).

### I've read and agree with the following

- [X] I've checked all open and closed issues and my request is not there.
- [X] I've checked all open and closed pull requests and my request is not there.

comment.body: browsing the issues, I found this one https://github.com/metallb/metallb/issues/157 which talks about a similar idea, except in this case the IP would be assigned by DHCP.

issue.title: Add option to configure BGP connect time
issue.body:
This commit introduces an option for users to modify the BGP connect time setting, which controls the time BGP waits between connection attempts to a neighbor.
Fixes #2093

comment.body:
another general comment:

while working on this, some of the times i got a race on this test: 

```
--- FAIL: TestNodeReconciler_SetupWithManager (12.76s)
    testing.go:1446: race detected during execution of test
```
i think i didn't add anything that could cause a race but thought it may be worth mentioning.

here is an example:

https://github.com/AlinaSecret/metallb/actions/runs/6616096555/job/17969668010

issue.title: Add option to configure BGP connect time
issue.body:
This commit introduces an option for users to modify the BGP connect time setting, which controls the time BGP waits between connection attempts to a neighbor.
Fixes #2093

comment.body:
general comment:
as i mentioned in the commit message:
"Various unit tests, are updated to include an initial value for the
connectTime field. This is necessary because, in GoLang structs,
numerical and duration fields that are not set contain a value of zero.
The config updater does not distinguish between unset fields and fields
explicitly set to zero. In the case of the connectTime field, this
cannot be zero, so it needs to be explicitly set to include a different
value in all end-to-end test structs."

just wanted to add that i don't think that the best solution for not updating unset values so they are created with there default values is  just setting the values explicitly as i did in the pr. i think maybe need to add a flag or a parameter with which fields not to update so fields with the value of zero wont be updated   should be added to the conifgupdater update function. but i think its out of scope from this pr

comment.body: Not really. When you look above, I had checked that the webhook service is existing by using an ubuntu/alpine pod with curl to the webhook endpoint. It answers with an error message that the json content is missing. So, the webhook exists. But it does not validate the CRDs properly, so I set the "failurePolicy: Ignore".
